Note

Archon depends on web3 1.0. This version of web3 is still in Beta so usage is subject to change unexpectedly with updates to the underlying library. _.

Getting Started¶

  1. Install Archon from NPM
yarn add eth-archon
  1. Import Archon into your project
var Archon = require('Archon')
  1. Initialize an instance of Archon using an Ethereum Provider.
var archon = new Archon('https://mainnet.infura.io')

Note

A provider is needed so that the codebase knows how to connect to the ethereum network. You can use a connection to your own node, or to a hosted node such as infura. web3.js will make RPC calls to the provider to fetch data from the blockchain.

  1. Set an environment variable for your IPFS gateway <optional>

If you are using IPFS URI’s (ipfs://) you need to specify a trusted gateway so that the data can be fetched from the IPFS network.

process.env.IPFS_GATEWAY_URI = "https://cloudflare-ipfs.com/ipfs/"

Now you are all set! Use your archon object to interact with arbitrable and arbitrator contracts on the blockchain.
